title: Nocturne brings private accounts to Ethereum - Blockworks
summary: Nocturne, a privacy-focused protocol on Ethereum, has launched its first version (v1) on mainnet, allowing users to deposit and receive funds privately through "stealth addresses." These addresses are generated within Nocturne smart contracts and can be used to trade "hot assets" like DeFi tokens that represent state via output tokens. The company plans to extend smart account compatibility to arbitrary protocols using zero-knowledge technology in the future. Nocturne's CEO, Luke Tchang, stated that the goal is to make privacy a standard feature at the account layer, and the v1 launch is the first step towards achieving this. Users can access Nocturne v1 through a private vault user interface, which currently offers limited capabilities like deposits, token transfers, and private swapping and staking.

title: SEC delays Hashdex Nasdaq Ethereum ETF application to next year - The Block
summary: The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has delayed its decision on the Hashdex Nasdaq Ethereum ETF application until next year. The SEC needs more time to consider the proposal, which seeks to hold both spot ether and futures contracts. This is not the first time the SEC has delayed a decision on an ether ETF, as it has approved futures-based products but not spot ether ETFs. Other firms, including Grayscale and BlackRock, are also waiting for approval of spot ether ETFs.

title: BlackRock Files for Spot Ethereum ETF After Registering Entity in Delaware - Yahoo Finance
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in under 256 tokens:

BlackRock has filed for an Ethereum ETF with the SEC, following its registration of the iShares Ethereum Trust entity in Delaware. The proposed ETF aims to mirror Ethereum's price performance. Coinbase Custody Trust Company will act as custodian, and the ETF will use the CME CF Bitcoin Reference Rate as its benchmark. The news led to a 2% increase in Ether's price. BlackRock previously filed for a Bitcoin spot ETF in June, with the SEC's decision still pending. (249 tokens)

title: Fidelity Files for Spot Ethereum ETF with SEC - Watcher Guru
summary: Fidelity, a $4.5 trillion asset manager, has filed for a Spot Ethereum ETF with the SEC. This follows BlackRock's recent ETF application. If approved, Fidelity will provide Spot Ethereum ETF services to clients, opening up the cryptocurrency market to new institutional investors. The ETF will consist of ETH held by the New York Department of Financial Services on behalf of the Fidelity Ethereum Fund. This development comes as asset managers increasingly seek to broaden access to crypto for average investors, despite the SEC's resistance. Fidelity has been vocal in its praise for Ethereum, with its Director of Research predicting its growth in the coming years.

title: Fidelity Joins BlackRock in Race for Ethereum ETF - Decrypt
summary: Fidelity, a financial services giant, has filed with the SEC to launch an ETF that tracks the price of Ethereum, the native token of the Ethereum blockchain network. The proposed ETF, Fidelity Ethereum Fund, would trade on the Cboe BZX Exchange under the ticker symbol ETHF. This filing comes after BlackRock submitted its own Ethereum ETF application, and follows growing pressure from investors for a spot bitcoin ETF. Fidelity argues that a spot ETF would provide a safer way for mainstream investors to gain exposure to digital assets, while the SEC has typically required surveillance-sharing agreements between an ETF's listing exchange and the underlying spot market for an asset. Other asset managers, including Invesco and Galaxy Digital, have also filed for crypto ETFs this year.

title: Blackrock Files for Ethereum ETF: Here's What We Know - Blockonomi
summary: BlackRock, the world's largest asset manager, has filed for regulatory approval to launch an Ethereum exchange-traded fund (ETF) with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). The proposed ETF, called the iShares Ethereum Trust, aims to provide direct exposure to ether, the native cryptocurrency of the Ethereum blockchain. BlackRock has selected Coinbase Custody to hold the ETF's ether reserves, and the fund will use CF Benchmarks' reference rates as benchmarks. The filing represents a major bet on crypto by BlackRock and comes after it filed for a spot bitcoin ETF in June. The move is seen as a sign of growing institutional interest in direct cryptocurrency exposure and could potentially improve the chances of regulatory approval for spot crypto ETFs.

title: Fidelity Investments floats fresh Ethereum ETF application - crypto.news
summary: Fidelity Investments has filed for a spot Ethereum ETF with the SEC, seeking to list and trade shares of the Fidelity Ethereum Fund on the Cboe BZX Exchange. This move comes after BlackRock's Ethereum ETF filing and places Fidelity among seven contenders vying for approval. Fidelity argues that the lack of a low-risk option for US citizens to engage with ETH and digital assets underscores the need for a similar avenue for US investors, particularly in light of the recent court ruling that rejected the SEC's denial of Grayscale's application for a spot Bitcoin ETF. However, the SEC has yet to approve any spot crypto ETF, and the path forward for these products remains uncertain.

title: Fidelity files for spot Ethereum ETF, says approval would be 'major win' for US investors - The Block
summary: Fidelity has filed for a spot Ethereum ETF, following its previous filing for a spot bitcoin ETF. The company believes approval would be a "major win" for US investors, who are currently facing significant risk without such products as they seek alternative, riskier ways to get exposure to the crypto asset space. The filing references a recent court ruling that found the SEC failed to provide a coherent reason for rejecting spot crypto ETFs, and notes that Fidelity's filing is in response to investor demand for more risk-managed exposure to cryptocurrencies.

title: Ethereum Foundation Shifts Millions in ETH Before 6% Price Decline - U.Today
summary: The Ethereum Foundation recently transferred a significant amount of ETH, worth $2.36 million, to a grant provider wallet. This move has sparked speculation about the Foundation's motives, with some suggesting it may be preparing to sell its holdings. The Foundation has also made other ETH transfers, including 75 ETH worth $148,000 to a different wallet. Meanwhile, Ethereum's price has seen significant fluctuations, reaching highs of $2,100 before retreating to $1,909. Despite this, the news of BlackRock's filing for an Ethereum ETF has had a positive impact on the cryptocurrency's price.

title: Ethereum Name Service decries Unstoppable Domains patent as a threat to open-source ethos - CryptoSlate
summary: Ethereum Name Service (ENS) lead developer Nick Johnson accused Unstoppable Domains of patenting open-source innovations without contribution, threatening the open-source ethos of web3 naming. Johnson called for Unstoppable Domains to donate its first patent under an unconditional and irrevocable patent pledge. Unstoppable Domains founder Matthew Gould emphasized collaborative efforts and discussed the importance of open dialogue and patent non-aggression pacts. Gould invited ENS to join the Web3 Domain Alliance to foster open collaboration in shaping web3 naming standards.

title: Fidelity jumps aboard the spot ETH ETF train - Blockworks
summary: Fidelity has filed a 19b-4 application with the SEC for an ethereum ETF, named the Fidelity Ethereum Fund. This comes after BlackRock also filed a 19b-4 for an ether ETF last week. Fidelity's proposed fund aims to track the performance of ETH, as measured by the Fidelity Ethereum Index, and will be listed on CBOE. The SEC has yet to make a decision on any spot bitcoin ETFs, including Fidelity's, and has recently delayed several with November deadlines.

title: Ethereum's (ETH) Rally: Prelude to Further Gains as Price Exceeds $2,000 Again - U.Today
summary: Ethereum (ETH) has surged past $2,000 for the first time since April 2023, fueled by whale activity and potential interest in a spot ETF. Whales have been actively buying and selling ETH, with one investor realizing a profit of nearly $50 million. Solana (SOL) has also seen significant gains, with a potential support level at $60 and a bullish trend indicated by technical indicators. Cardano (ADA) is also showing a bullish trend, with a significant uptrend and increased trading volume. However, market volatility suggests that a pullback is possible, with support levels around $0.38-0.40.

FX Empire cautions readers to perform their own research and understand the risks involved in investing in cryptocurrencies and CFDs.

title: Ethereum tops ESG ranking again while Bitcoin continues to struggle - AMBCrypto English
summary: Ethereum has topped the ESG ranking for the second time in a row, while Bitcoin struggled with a low score due to its high energy consumption. The ESG ranking, assessed by CCData in partnership with the Crypto Carbon Ratings Institute, evaluates cryptos on environmental, social, and governance parameters. Ethereum scored 78, followed by Solana, Polkadot, and Binance Coin, which earned an "AA" grade. Bitcoin's low environmental score of 7 impacted its overall ranking, with a score of 57.37. The ranking matters as it helps investors make sustainable investment decisions and regulatory frameworks are integrating ESG factors.

title: Who is Steven Nerayoff and What Does ETHgate Recording Mean for Ethereum and Buterin? - CCN.com
summary: Steven Nerayoff, a former Ethereum advisor, has released a recording of a conversation he had with Vitalik Buterin in 2015, sparking fresh interest in the "ETHgate" conspiracy theory. Nerayoff claims that the recording shows Buterin was warned about potential legal trouble, but the recording does not provide concrete evidence of fraud or corruption. Nerayoff has been promoting allegations that Ethereum received preferential treatment from regulators, but his motives have been questioned due to his criminal extortion charges in 2019. The recording does shed light on Ethereum's difficult start, but the focus on speculation and absence of concrete evidence may distract from other concerns, such as the identity of Ethereum's earliest backers.

title: Bitcoin outstrips Ethereum in daily transaction fees for first time since 2020 - CryptoSlate
summary: Bitcoin transaction fees surpassed Ethereum's on a single day, reaching $11.6 million, the highest since 2020. However, when projected over a seven-day period, Ethereum still maintains its dominance with $9 million in transaction fees compared to Bitcoin's $5.5 million. This shift in daily metrics may indicate a changing dynamic, but Ethereum still leads in the weekly comparison.

title: DOGE Go Up: Ethereum and Solana Hit Hard By Sell-Off—But Dogecoin Makes Gains - Decrypt
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

This is despite a sell-off in the broader crypto market, with Bitcoin (BTC) taking a 2% hit and stablecoins dominating trading volume.

title: Spot Ethereum ETF Proposal Delayed by SEC - U.Today
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Despite the delay, there is a race to launch a spot Ethereum ETF, with BlackRock recently filing for one. SEC Chair Gensler has not explicitly stated whether Ether is a security, but industry experts expect the SEC to treat it more like Bitcoin and approve spot Ethereum ETFs in 2024.

title: Fidelity Wants to Create an Ether ETF, Joining BlackRock in Doubling Down on Crypto - CoinDesk
summary: Fidelity and BlackRock, two major financial firms, are planning to launch Ethereum (ETH) and Bitcoin (BTC) exchange-traded funds (ETFs), aiming to make crypto investments more accessible to retail investors. This move comes as the crypto market continues to gain mainstream recognition and acceptance.

title: Bitcoin (BTC) Topples Ethereum in Transaction Fees After 3 Years - CoinGape
summary: Bitcoin (BTC) has surpassed Ethereum (ETH) in daily cryptocurrency transaction fees after three years, with BTC's fees reaching $11.63 million compared to ETH's $8.44 million. This reversal is attributed to Bitcoin's recent surge in average transaction fees, which have increased by nearly 1,000% since November 1. The growth in Bitcoin's fees is seen as a positive development for miners, as it provides a much-needed boost to their revenue streams. However, the surge in fees may pose some inconvenience for users. The competition between Bitcoin and Ethereum remains dynamic, with each blockchain platform vying for dominance in the rapidly expanding world of DeFi and NFTs.

title: Bitcoin Surpasses Ethereum in Fees First Time in Years - U.Today
summary:
Sure! Here's a summary of the article in 256 tokens or less:

Bitcoin has surpassed Ethereum in daily transaction fees for the first time in three years, with $11.63 million in fees vs $8.44 million for Ethereum. This is seen as a positive development for Bitcoin miners, who have faced a less profitable year. The recent increase in Bitcoin fees comes as the upcoming halving will reduce miners' block rewards, making fee revenue more important. Additionally, Bitcoin's Ordinals inscriptions are outperforming Ethereum in NFT sales.

title: Ethereum's EigenLayer Gears Up for Mainnet Phase Two in 2024 - CoinGape
summary: EigenLayer, a player in Ethereum's re-staking arena, is gearing up for its mainnet phase two launch in 2024, which will allow users to delegate their staked Ethereum (ETH) to operators of EigenDA. This move will facilitate rollups, a secondary scaling solution, to integrate with EigenLayer. The upcoming phase promises significant enhancements, including reduced transaction fees for rollups and the emergence of Liquid Restaked Tokens (LRT) to simplify the staking process. LRT protocols, such as Ether Fi, Stader Labs, and Genesis LRT, are expected to herald a new era in Ethereum staking, offering potential 25% APY on ETH.

title: Ethereum ETF Race: BlackRock Wants An Ether Spot ETF - NewsBTC
summary: BlackRock, a leading asset management company, has filed an application with the US SEC to launch an Ethereum Spot ETF. The application was submitted on November 15, and BlackRock is waiting for approval. The ETF would allow investors to own a fractional undivided beneficial interest in the net assets of the Trust, which would primarily consist of ether held by the Ether Custodian on behalf of the Trust. The filing has caused a stir in the cryptocurrency community, with the price of Ethereum surging almost 2% following the announcement. The US SEC has not yet approved any Ethereum Spot ETF filings or Spot Bitcoin ETF applications, and the regulatory body has delayed multiple applications to be reviewed from January 2024.

title: Ethereum Insider Exposing Vitalik Buterin Fraud in 48 Hours - Cryptonews
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in 256 tokens or less:

Insider Steven Nerayoff promises to reveal evidence of alleged fraudulent activities by Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin within 48 hours. Nerayoff has been vocal about his claims for weeks, focusing on Buterin's involvement in misconduct and accusing him of intentionally promoting fraudulent ICOs on Ethereum's network. He also disputes Buterin's innovations and the viability of his original white paper. Nerayoff positioned himself as a whistleblower and claims to have been contacted by many related parties since first speaking out. The price of Ether has failed to break through its 2022 highs amid the accusations.

title: Fidelity Follows BlackRock, Files For Spot Ethereum ETF - Where Next for Ether (ETH)? - Cryptonews
summary: Fidelity and BlackRock, two of the largest asset managers, have filed for spot Ethereum ETFs with the Chicago Board Options Exchange (CBOE). Fidelity's Ethereum Trust, called the Fidelity Ethereum Trust, aims to provide investors with exposure to the price of Ether (ETH). This move comes as major asset managers double down on their bets on cryptocurrencies, with many analysts expecting approval for these applications as soon as January. Despite a recent pullback, ETH is still up 28% since October and could benefit from a broader market rally and improving macro conditions. However, some investors may be hesitant due to poor demand for recently launched Ether futures ETFs in the US. If ETH can break above the $2,150 resistance level, it could rally towards $3,600. Additionally, a bullish macro backdrop, spot ETFs, and Ether deflation could provide further support to the cryptocurrency in the coming months.

title: BlackRock files for spot ethereum ETF to further crypto push - The Economic Times
summary: BlackRock, a leading asset management firm, has filed for a spot ethereum exchange-traded fund (ETF) with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). This marks the company's doubling down on its cryptocurrency bets, following its filing for a spot bitcoin ETF in June. The proposed ETF, iShares Ethereum Trust, will give investors access to ether without directly owning it, and will be listed on Nasdaq if approved. BlackRock is converting the trust to a "spot" ETF, meaning it will own ether instead of futures products tied to the crypto token. While the SEC has previously rejected spot crypto ETFs due to concerns over fraud and manipulation, a recent federal appeals court ruling has given hope to companies seeking to launch such investment vehicles. BlackRock will compete with crypto natives and traditional finance giants for market share, with Coinbase Custody serving as the proposed ETF's custodian.

title: Someone Just Paid $400K for This Ethereum NFT of Vitalik as a Jester - Decrypt
summary:

Someone paid $400K for an NFT of Vitalik Buterin as a jester, breaking records. The digital painting sold for 200 ETH, with the creator receiving a 10% royalty. The sale injects hope into the long-sluggish NFT ecosystem, despite creator fees becoming optional on major platforms like OpenSea. The first owner of the NFT, MaxStealth, will receive a portion of the creator fee, worth over $13,000.
